title: Senate measure would support limits on AI chip sales to China
description: WASHINGTON — Senators on both sides of the aisle on Thursday signed onto a call to keep advanced artificial intelligence chips from being sold to China. Sen. Chris Coons, D-Del., unveiled an as-yet unnumbered resolution focused on the importance of maintaining U.S. “primacy in artificial intelligence” and on restricting access to the chips required to build so-called frontier AI models. The ...
content:
By Allison Mollenkamp, CQ-Roll Call
WASHINGTON — Senators on both sides of the aisle on Thursday signed onto a call to keep advanced artificial intelligence chips from being sold to China.

title: Sam Altman drops a shocking hint about who he wants as OpenAI’s CEO; says it ‘clearly will happen someday’
description: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has predicted that companies led entirely by artificial intelligence are imminent, declaring that “shame on me if OpenAI isnt the first big company run by an AI CEO.” Speaking on the Conversations with Tyler podcast, he suggested this could happen within a few years. While Altman envisions AI outperforming human executives, he admits human presence will still matter, highlighting a coming era of AI-driven corporate leadership.

title: The Nasdaq fall: Index suffers steepest weekly drop since April amid AI stock sell-off and market jitters
description: The Nasdaq Composite saw its biggest weekly fall since April 2025. Investors worry about artificial intelligence stock valuations causing the drop. Major AI companies like Nvidia and AMD experienced significant declines. This pullback follows a strong rally driven by AI optimism. Broader US markets showed some resilience. Global markets also faced caution. Economic indicators added to market anxiety.

title: AI boom drives Taiwan's exports to record $61.8 billion in October
description: Taiwan's exports in October surged 49.7% year-on-year to $61.8 billion, a record monthly high, driven by strong global demand for artificial intelligence technologies (AI), according to Focus Taiwan.

title: AI boom drives Taiwan's exports to record $61.8 billion in October
description: Taiwan's exports in October surged 49.7 per cent year-on-year to USD 61.8 billion, a record monthly high, driven by strong global demand for artificial intelligence technologies (AI), according to Focus Taiwan.
content:
Taipei [Taiwan], November 8 (ANI): Taiwan's exports in October surged 49.7 per cent year-on-year to USD 61.8 billion, a record monthly high, driven by strong global demand for artificial intelligence technologies (AI), according to Focus Taiwan.

title: Breaking Bad creator Vince Gilligan slams AI as plagiarism machine
description: Vince Gilligan openly condemns artificial intelligence as a plagiarism machine and refuses to use it in his work. His criticism highlights concerns over AI's impact on creativity and ethical challenges in the tech industry.
